title: AI-Powered Book Creation Platform Backend Blueprint
description: A comprehensive backend architecture for an end-to-end book creation system. This blueprint defines the data models for transforming keywords into manuscripts, orchestrating AI workflows for brainstorming, structuring, and writing, while maintaining context memory and production safety.

workflows.name: Project Initialization
steps: Receive seed keyword and user intent
Orchestrate Brainstorm Engine to generate topic landscape
Run Thesis Generator to ensure academic rigor or narrative depth
Generate 3-5 Book Concept variants (Title, Tagline, Audience)
Persist Concept options to BookConcept table

workflows.name: Structure & TOC Builder
steps: Receive selected Book Concept ID
Generate recursive outline (Parts -> Chapters -> Sections)
Analyze logical flow and narrative arc
Create Chapter records with 'Draft' status and sequence order
Return TOC JSON to frontend for user adjustment

workflows.name: Chapter Generation Engine
steps: Fetch Project Context (Tone, Audience, Thesis)
Fetch Previous Chapter Summary (for continuity)
Construct prompt with Style Lock instructions
Stream generation from LLM Provider
Save raw content to Chapter record
Generate summary for next chapter's context
Update word count and status

workflows.name: Export Pipeline
steps: Retrieve all chapters sorted by order_index
Apply formatting templates (Academic, Standard, Modern)
Generate Front Matter (Title Page, Copyright, TOC)
Compile to target format (PDF, EPUB, DOCX)
Upload artifact to secure object storage
Generate signed download URL

migrationPlan: 1. Initialize PostgreSQL schema with Users and Projects tables. 2. Create BookConcepts table with JSONB columns for flexible brainstorming data. 3. Create Chapters table with foreign key to Projects and index on (project_id, order_index). 4. Implement CoverDesigns table. 5. Seed SystemPrompts table with initial prompt engineering templates (Brainstorm, TOC, Writing). 6. Set up vector database (e.g., Pinecone/pgvector) if advanced RAG is needed for 'Project State Memory'.
openapi:
openapi: 3.0.0
info:
  title: Book Creator AI API
  version: 1.0.0
paths:
  /projects:
    post:
      summary: Create a new book project
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              type: object
              properties:
                keyword: {type: string}
                genre: {type: string}
  /projects/{id}/structure:
    post:
      summary: Generate TOC
  /chapters/{id}/generate:
    post:
      summary: Generate chapter content
      parameters:
        - name: mode
          in: query
          schema:
            type: string
            enum: [draft, rewrite, expand]

authPolicies: OAuth2 with JWT for session management
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for Enterprise teams (Editor vs Viewer)
API Rate limiting per user tier to prevent cost overruns
safety.concurrencyPlan: Use a distributed job queue (e.g., BullMQ or AWS SQS) for all AI generation tasks. Chapter generation is asynchronous; the client polls or opens a WebSocket for progress updates. Max concurrency set to 3 concurrent generations per user.
constraints: Max word count per chapter generation (approx 3000 words)
Strict input validation to prevent prompt injection attacks
indexes: CREATE INDEX idx_chapters_project_order ON chapters (project_id, order_index)
